intro: Pseudomorus sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. It has rough, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
